p.s: In his article We are entering an era of pandemics - it will end only when we protect the rainforest Peter Daszak, the president of EcoHealth Alliance who'swhose goal is to analyse and prevent pandemics explains with regard to the Corona-crisis, how pandemics arise and spread and how they could be prevented through protecting the nature, especially wildlife.
The author believes, that diseases are the products of humans disrupting the wildlife.
He explains that animals, especially those in tropical areas carry millions of diseases in them without us noticing or knowing about them in detail.

If a human being gets in contact with those viruses, for example through butchering animals or entering their caves and beeingbeing exposed to their feces, and infect himself with the virus, according to the autherauthor, this affects the whole world.
He states that the human species is better connected than ever before, and that this fact makes it easier for the disease to spread.
At the same time the author also sees a problem in humans expanding their settlements because it brings people in contact with the wildlife which causes the spreading of diseases on humans.
To prevent this from happening the author proposes to act against the destroying of wildlife and wants people to take measures against wildlife trade and for sustainability.
His goal is to prevent the dangerous contact between infected animals and humans to stop the arise of new pandemics.
